item.title: [PI] NPC-Drops (Possible Solution)

item.description:
@CarterInk wrote:

[quote=“Spencer4678, post:2, topic:395586”]I’ve had donators complain about not getting drops, and their player rights is 4. So would that code still work to get ranks 0-4 drops?

Anyways, THANKS A LOT for this info.[/quote]

Take w\e your max setting is (If admin is 6, use 7) and just go up by one.

If admin is 6, then use < 7

item.title: [PI] NPC-Drops (Possible Solution)
item.dc:creator: @CarterInk CarterInk
item.description:
@CarterInk wrote:

Well I’m one of the many people who have had problems with NPC’s not dropping items on PI, and after many hours browsing help threads and typing www.google.com about a thousand times I think I may have found the problem most people have been running into.

open Npchandler.java and search for
if (c.playerRights == 0 || c.playerRights == 1 && c.memberStatus <= 2) {

I would assume you have been testing on an admin account (as I had), and after seeing this line of code I made a new account, killed a rockcrab, and boom! drops.

So you can either remove this If command or change the playerrights part. Try it and post here if it solves your problem

EDIT: I tried removing it and I got a ton of compile errors so just do this.
if (c.playerRights < 4 || c.playerRights == 1 && c.memberStatus <= 2) {

then compile and run, it’ll fix your drops, but in the long run you’ll need to remove it and make sure it compiles but this will atleast get your drops working.

Read full topic
